properties.Title: Jacques Marquette-Louis Jolliet Memorial
properties.Location (neighborhood Name): Belmont and Lake Shore Drive (Lincoln Park)
properties.Context (Event): Marquette and Joillet, aided by "their Indian guides," were the first Europeans to explore the upper Mississippi, including the land that would one day become Chicago

properties.Title: Fort Dearborn Massacre
properties.Location (neighborhood Name): Currently in storage (DuSable Bridge). Formerly located 18th and Calumet, Chicago Illinois 1893. Formerly located Clarke House, 18th Street between Prairie & Indiana Avenues, Grounds, Chicago, Illinois
properties.Architect/designer:
Rohl-Smith, Carl, 1848-1900, sculptor.
Henry-Bonnard Bronze Company, founder.
properties.Context (Event): Depicts conflict at the Battle of Fort Dearborn between Potawotami Indigenous peoples and US troops amidst the War of 1812, wherein more than 50 white settlers were killed, including some women and children (thus, the decision by some to use the term "massacre")

properties.Title: Kinzie Mansion Plaque
properties.Location (neighborhood Name): Currently in storage, was near DuSable Bridge
properties.Context (Event): Marks the ground near which the mansion of John Kinzie and where his daughter, Ellen, the "city's first white child" was born

properties.Title: Jean Baptiste Beaubien Plaque
properties.Context (Event): Recognizes Beaubien as "Chicago's second civilian," presumably following Kinzie

properties.Title: DuSable Bridge Reliefs: Defense, The Pioneers,Discoverers, and Regeneration
properties.Architect/designer: Henry Haring and James Earle Fraser
properties.Context (Event): On the north end, "The Discoverers" represents French expeditions into the Chicago area in the 17th century, and "The Pioneers" represents the establishment of white settlements. On the south end, "The Defense" is an "unsettling" depiction of the conflict at Fort Dearborn and "Regeneration" is representative of the "spirit of rebuilding" of the city after the fire in 1871

properties.Title: Tablet dedicated to Cavelier De La Salle and Tablet dedicated to Jolliet and Marquette
properties.Context (Event): Dedicated to the European settlers that were shown the linking portage between Lake Michigan and the Chicago River by Indigenous peoples

properties.Title: General Philip Henry Sheridan
properties.Context (Event): Sheridan was a Civil War general in the Union and later head of the Department of the Missouri, where he forced Indigenous populations off of their lands using "scorched-earth tactics" such as overseeing the poaching of bison on said land that lead to near-extinction; Statue was originally dedicated for Sheridan's work of "maintaining law and order" during the Great Fire in Chicago, where he was stationed at the time (https://www.chicagoparkdistrict.com/parks-facilities/general-philip-henry-sheridan-monument). In September 1934, the Chicago Association of West Pointers had the monument rededicated in memoriam of the 70th anniversary of the Battle of Opequon, which he led (https://www.chicagoparkdistrict.com/media/lincoln-park-general-philip-henry-sheridan-monument).

properties.Title: Damen Avenue Bridge Marquette Monument
properties.Architect/designer: E.P. Seidel based on a sketch by Thomas A . O'Shaughnessy
properties.Context (Event): Another dedicated to Marquette's time near Chicago and his journal that "first brought to the world's attention the advantages of soil, climate and transportation facilities" in the area

properties.Title: Bust of Melville Fuller
properties.Context (Event): Fuller was an attorney that moved to Chicago in the 1850s who served on the South Park Board of Commissioners in the 1880s, playing a big role in the development of Chicago's parks, and was later appointed as Chief Justice on the US Supreme Court

properties.Title: Italo Balbo Monument
properties.Context (Event): Gifted by Mussolini in commemoration of the transcontinental flight of the Italian Air Force led by fascist aviator Italo Balbo

properties.Title: Statue of the Republic
properties.Context (Event): Replica of the original which was around 3 times the size of the rebuilt edition, which was erected in honor of the 25th anniversary of the Chicago world's fair; Dedicated to commemorate the 25th anniversary of the Chicago World's Columbian Exposition as well as Illinois' 100th year of statehood. https://www.chicagoparkdistrict.com/parks-facilities/statue-republic
